Description: Part of the side-wall of the rectangular wooden coffin of Horsiesi; painted Hieroglyphic text on a layer of plaster.
Curator's comments: Another fragment of this coffin is in the University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology (E126178 A-C), with publication in progress by David Silverman (2018)
Associated places: Named in inscription: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt)
